result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Lonnie Duane Severson was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Lonnie Duane Severson was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 11:21 AM.
Defendant Lonnie Duane Severson in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Bucher informs the court this matter is resolved by a plea agreement.
Attorney Bucher files plea and waiver of rights form with the court.
Defendant changes plea from "NOT GUILTY" to "NO CONTEST"
Defendant enters plea of "NO CONTEST" to Counts 1 & 2
Dismissing Count 3 Per/Pleas Agreement.
Court questions defendant RE: plea and waiver of rights, court also questions attorney Bucher RE: her clients plea and waiver of rights.
That there is a factual basis.
Court finds plea and waiver is made knowingly and voluntarily & intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY" to Counts 1 & 2.
State moves for joint recommendation of the parties.
Attorney Bucher concurs with the state & makes statement on behalf of her client.
Defendant makes statement to the court.

Count 1
8- years total
3- initial confinement
5- extended supervision
$600.00 base 
36 month IID & Revocation
Costs on Count 1 only.

Count 2 
1 year Lafayette County Jail concurrent with Count 1
NO COSTS ON COUNT 2

Count 3
Dismissed

THE COURT: GRANTS motion of the parties and adopts the joint recommendation of the parties (plea agreement).

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.
Defendant shall consent to a reasonable request of a law enforcement officer, based on probable cause, to submit to a breath, blood test for purposes of determining the quantity of alcohol or drugs in defendant's breath, blood.
